kba

Class ContentItem

  • java.lang.Object
    • kba.ContentItem
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Comparable<ContentItem>, org.apache.thrift.TBase<ContentItem,ContentItem._Fields>

    public class ContentItem
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.apache.thrift.TBase<ContentItem,ContentItem._Fields>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    ContentItem is the thrift analog of http://trec-kba.org/schemas/v1.0/content-item.json The JSON version has a 'stages' property that contains descriptions **and also names** of additional properties on the ContentItem. That was overly flexible. Each content-item in the KBA corpus can have a 'cleansed' and 'ner' property. 'cleansed' is generated from 'raw', and 'ner' is generated from 'cleansed.' Generally, 'cleansed' is a tag-stripped version of 'raw', and 'ner' is the output of a named entity recognizer that generates one-word-per-line output. For the kba-stream-corpus-2012, the specific tag-stripping and NER configurations were: 'raw' --> boilerpipe 1.2.0 ArticleExtractor --> 'cleansed' 'cleansed' -> Stanford CoreNLP ver 1.2.0 with annotators {tokenize, cleanxml, ssplit, pos, lemma, ner}, property pos.maxlen=100" --> 'ner'
    See Also:
    Serialized Form
